docreader.range

Class FigureReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • docreader.range.RangeReader
      • docreader.range.FigureReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GenericReader<java.lang.Integer>

    class FigureReader
extends RangeReader
    Extracts "pseudo floating" figures from the input document

    These figures usually have the following structure:

    1. a paragraph consisting of nothing but an image-reference (= a special character sequence). This image is technically non-floating (i.e. it does not use MS Word's limited capabilities of floating figures but is rather attached to the surrounding text) AND
    2. a paragraph with certain formatting following the image, which holds the figure number and caption text
    Exception: Sometimes number + caption can also be in the same paragraph as the image itself, separated only by a line break.
    Exception 2: Sometimes there may be an empty paragraph between the image and the caption.

    Author:
    Moritz Dorka

    • Constructor Detail

      • FigureReader

        public FigureReader(ReaderData readerData,
                    RequirementTemporary parentRequirement,
                    int initialParagraphIndex,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> pictureOffsets,
                    org.apache.poi.hwpf.usermodel.Paragraph captionParagraph)
        Parameters:
        readerData - global readerData
        parentRequirement - enclosing requirement to which the resulting figure will be attached as a child
        initialParagraphIndex - index number of the paragraph to read
        pictureOffsets - offsets of the characters which contain the link to the pictures; key is the offset, value only applies for shapes (startOffset of containing range)
        captionParagraph - "artificial" paragraph containing the caption or null if the caption is in the following paragraph of the document
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the arguments is illegal

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public java.lang.Integer read()
        Read a "pseudo floating" figure

        "pseudo floating" means we have an image which spans an entire line (or paragraph) immediately followed (either on the next line or the next paragraph) by a caption.

        Returns:
        number of paragraphs to skip (that is: 0-based number of paragraphs read)
        See Also:
        GenericReader.read()

      • detectFigureCaption

        private int detectFigureCaption()
        extract a figure caption from the word input stream
        Returns:
        number of paragraphs to skip because of the caption; may be -1 if there is no figure
